sentence.text: ________-stimulated __________________ turnover in endometrium of ewes is influenced by stage of the estrous cycle, pregnancy, and intrauterine infusion of ovine conceptus secretory proteins

Three experiments (Exp) assessed the influence of stage of the estrous cycle, pregnancy, and intrauterine infusion of ovine conceptus secretory proteins (oCSP) on turnover of ______________________ (the putative second-messenger for ________-stimulated secretion of prostaglandin F2 alpha) in ovine endometrium during luteolysis and maternal recognition of pregnancy

For each Exp, 100 mg endometrium was incubated, in duplicate, for 2 h with 10 microCi [3H] inositol and treated with 0 or 100 nM ________ (OT) for 20 min, then [3H]inositol mono-, bis-, and trisphosphates (IP1, IP2, and ___, respectively) were quantified
Carbachol and ________ stimulate the generation of ___________________ in the guinea pig myometrium
In the guinea pig myometrium prelabelled with myo-[2-3H]inositol, carbachol and ________ enhanced a concentration-dependent and rapid release of ___ which preceded that of IP2 and IP1

Hesperidin, the most important _________ of Citrus sp., significantly increases HDL and lowers ___________, LDL, total lipid and triglyceride plasma levels in normolipidemic rats and in rats with diet- and triton-induced hyperlipidemia

This action of ____________ 25-35 is not altered by pretreatment with the calcium channel blockers nifedipine or cobalt, with the depleter of intracellular calcium stores cyclopiazonic acid, or with the _______________ inhibitor neomycin
The influence of myrigalone B, a _________ from the fruit exudate of Myrica gale L. on Cu(2+)-induced oxidation of low density lipoprotein from ___________ fed rabbits was investigated
________ (OT) and vasopressin (AVP) stimulate _______ and glucagon release from the pancreas, and evoke _______ secretion from the rat insulinoma cell line, RINm5F
Signal transduction in pancreatic beta-cells: Regulation of _______ secretion by information flow in the _______________/Protein kinase C pathway
The physiologic regulation of glucose-induced _______ secretion is dependent upon the activation of information flow in the _______________ (PLC)/protein kinase C (PKC) signal transduction system

When rat islet are cultured for short periods, the content and activation of ___ in response to glucose decreases and this biochemical defect in signal transduction is paralleled by significant reductions in glucose-induced _______ secretion

Biphasic _______ secretion can be evoked and time-dependent potentiation can be induced in mouse islets by carbachol, an agonist that activates an isozyme of ___ distinct from that activated by glucose

When taken in their entirety, the experimental evidence suggests that the activation of ___ is an essential component in the physiologic regulation of _______ secretion and that disordered activation of the enzyme culminates in disordered _______ release
_______ beta protein (25-35) stimulation of _______________ in LA-N-2 cells
This _______________ stimulation by _______ beta protein appeared to be pertussis toxin sensitive
It is possible that this _______________ stimulation by _______ beta protein is a receptor-mediated process

_______ beta protein stimulation of _______________ was absent from LA-N-2 cells previously treated with norepinephrine, trans-1-amino-1,3-cyclopentanedicarboxylic acid (t-ACPD), bombesin, or _______ beta peptide
It is suggested that this observed _______ beta protein stimulation of _______________ may be responsible for the elevated quantity of inositol seen in the brains of Alzheimer's disease patients
Effects of ________, arginine-vasopressin and lysine-vasopressin on _______ and glucagon secretion in sheep
The effects of the posterior-pituitary peptides ________ (OT), arginine-vasopressin (AVP) and lysine-vasopressin (LVP) on _______ and glucagon secretion were examined in adult sheep
The maximal _______ responses induced by __ and AVP were very similar, but the threshold and maximal doses of AVP for increasing plasma _______ were higher than those of __
______ upregulates the expression of ____________________ (UCP-2) mRNA in islets of normal rats, but has no effect in islets of obese Zucker Diabetic Fatty (ZDF) rats with mutated leptin receptors

_______ secretion is regulated by changes in blood glucose, as well as by peptides from the gastrointestinal tract and neurotransmitters that activate the pancreatic islet adenylyl cyclase (e.g., glucagon-like peptide-1) and _______________ (PLC) (e.g., acetylcholine) signaling pathways to further potentiate glucose-induced _______ secretion
However, leptin did constrain the enhanced ___-mediated _______ secretion characteristic of islets from ob/ob mice, without influencing release from islets of lean mice
A specific enhancement in ___-mediated _______ secretion is the earliest reported developmental alteration in _______ secretion from islets of ob/ob mice, and thus a logical target for leptin action
This action of leptin on ___-mediated _______ secretion was dose-dependent, rapid-onset (i.e., within 3 min), and reversible
Leptin was equally effective in constraining the enhanced _______ release from islets of ob/ob mice caused by protein kinase C (PKC) activation, a downstream mediator of the ___ signal pathway
One function of leptin in control of body composition is thus to target a PKC-regulated component of the ___-PKC signaling system within islets to prevent hypersecretion of _______
_______ stimulates the release of the glycosyl phosphatidylinositol-anchored membrane dipeptidase from 3T3-L1 adipocytes through the action of a _______________

The hydrophilic form of MDP released from the cells on stimulation with _______ was recognized by antibodies against the inositol 1,2-cyclic monophosphate cross-reacting determinant, indicating that it had been generated by cleavage of its GPI anchor through the action of a _______________

During luteinization of bovine granulosa cells in vitro in the presence of _______, or _______ plus forskolin, there is a massive upregulation not only of progesterone production, but also of the gene for the peptide hormone ________, with secretion of the peptide into the medium
Interleukin-1 beta inhibits _______________ and _______ secretion at sites apart from KATP channel

Surprisingly, however, when islets were depolarized directly using either of two agonists, glyburide (which does not act via generation of purine nucleotides) or 40 mM K+ (which acts distal to KATP channel), ___ and _______ secretion were again obliterated by IL-1 beta

These data (together with the finding that IL-1 beta inhibited Ca(2+)-induced _______ release) suggest that, in addition to its effects on ATP synthesis and thereby on the KATP channel, IL-1 beta has at least two undescribed, distal effects to block both ___ as well as Ca(2+)-induced exocytosis
PKB, which is an important early PI 3-kinase-dependent component of _______ signalling pathways, is also down-regulated by ___-coupled agonists
Similarly, carbachol, but not ___ or DDAVP, induced a significant increase in membrane-associated ________________ (PKC) enzyme activity
In contrast, ___ had no effect on the distribution of any ___ isoform tested
The results demonstrate that potent antioxidants, such as __________, protect MM-LDL from lipoperoxidation and preserve their ability to efficiently deliver ___________ to cells

During wk 6, milk yield and dry matter intake (DMI) were recorded daily, and plasma concentrations of glucose, nonesterified fatty acids, urea, protein, growth hormone, _______, insulin-like growth factor I, ________, and prolactin were determined
Concurrent decrease of ___________ and _____________________ immunoreactivity during the light phase in the vole suprachiasmatic nucleus

Mean numbers of ___- and _____________________-immunoreactive neurons were determined in the suprachiasmatic nucleus of common voles, entrained to a 12:12 h light-dark (LD) cycle, at the beginning of the light period (zeitgeber time zero) and 6 h later (zeitgeber time six)
At zeitgeber time zero, mean numbers of ___- and _____________________- immunoreactive neurons were 2194 and 9897, respectively
To assess the possible involvement of ___ in ___ and IL-1 action in Leydig cells, the ___ inhibitor Calphostin C was tested
These results confirm that ___ and PMA activate ___ and indicate that IL-1 likely does not activate ___ in Leydig cells
The distribution of ____________________ (AVP) cells in the SCN overlapped with that of ___ in both species

Species differences in the location of the Ca2+-dependent ___ isoforms suggest differences in function such as the relaying of photic or non-photic information to the clock mechanism, or the synchronization of ___ neurons and their subsequent output signals
The two groups were similar in their morning thyroxin, triiodothyronine, TSH, estradiol, cortisol, gastrin, cholecystokinin, somatostatin, ________, _______ and IGF-1 levels
Constitutive expression of PKABA1 drastically suppressed expression of low- and high-pI _____________ and protease genes induced by __
The bovine ovarian granulosa cell model is a primary culture system where under stimulation by _______ or IGF-I and LH the endogenous ________ gene is massively upregulated
The deduced consensus closely resembled ___________ response elements in _____________ promoters
Long-term changes in gastrin, cholecystokinin and _______ in response to ________ treatment

The present study was designed to investigate how repeated injections of ________ influence plasma levels of vagally controlled hormones such as gastrin, cholecystokinin (CCK), _______ and somatostatin, as well as of endogenous ________ and glucose
In addition, both _______ and CCK levels were decreased in response to the ________ treatment when measured 3 and 10 days after the last injection (ANOVA; _______ p < 0.01, CCK p < 0.05)

When the alpha2-adrenoreceptor agonist clonidine (2.5 microgram/kg intracerebroventricularly) was administered 3 days after the 5-day treatment period with ________ or saline, plasma levels of _______ and CCK increased significantly (p < 0.05) in the ________-treated rats, when compared to saline-treated controls receiving clonidine only
In conclusion, these results show that ________ induces long-lasting changes in plasma levels of gastrin, CCK and _______, without affecting somatostatin or glucose levels

Signal transduction of ____________________-induced arachidonic acid release in H9c2 cardiac myoblasts: role of Ca2+ and the ________________-dependent activation of p42 mitogen-activated protein kinase
The Ca2+ ionophore, A23187 or ionomycin, mimicked the effect of ___, whereas the ________________ (PKC) activator, TPA, only induced a slight increase in AA release

Western blots demonstrated expression of PKCalpha, betaI, epsilon, delta, and zeta in H9c2 cells; ___ inhibitors (staurosporine or Ro 31-8220) or down-regulation of ________, betaI, epsilon, and delta by long-term (24 h) TPA treatment caused a partial blockade of the ___-induced response, whereas the A23187-induced AA release was unaffected by down-regulation of these isoforms

___- or TPA-induced activation and tyrosine phosphorylation of p42 MAPK were completely blocked by down-regulation of ________, betaI, epsilon, and delta, but still occurred, together with the cytosolic PLA2 mobility shift, in the absence of external Ca2+

These results show that ___-induced AA release in H9c2 cells is secondary to activation of the V1 receptor/Gq protein/PLCP pathway, leading to an influx of extracellular Ca2+ and activation of ________, betaI, epsilon, and delta
Overexpression of G11alpha and isoforms of _______________ in islet beta-cells reveals a lack of correlation between inositol phosphate accumulation and _______ secretion.
It has been suggested that _______ secretion from pancreatic islets may be mediated in part by activation of ________________ (PLCs) and phosphoinositide hydrolysis.

The purpose of this study was to determine whether the relatively modest fuel-stimulated _______ secretion responses of rodent beta-cell lines might be explained by inadequate expression or activation of ___ isoforms.

Adenovirus-mediated overexpression of ___-delta1, -beta1, or -beta3 in INS-1 or betaG 40/110 cells results in little or no enhancement in inositol phosphate (IP) accumulation and no improvement in _______ secretion when the cells are stimulated with glucose or carbachol, despite the fact that the overexpressed proteins are fully active in cell extracts.
Overexpression of ___-beta1 or -beta3 in normal rat islets elicits a larger increase in IP accumulation but, again, has no effect on _______ secretion.

Because the effect of carbachol on _______ secretion is thought to be mediated through muscarinic receptors that link to the Gq/11 class of heterotrimeric G proteins, we also overexpressed G11alpha in INS-1 cells, either alone or in concert with overexpression of ___-beta1 or -beta3.

Overexpression of G11alpha enhances IP accumulation, an effect slightly potentiated by co-overexpression of ___-beta1 or -beta3, but these maneuvers do not affect glucose or carbachol-stimulated _______ secretion.

In the present study we found that at increasing __ concentrations, increasing numbers of barley (Hordeum vulgare) cells showed the enhanced _______ secretion and vacuolation characteristic of the __ response
The activity of catalase was found to be significantly enhanced in the tissues of normal and ___________ fed rats administered 1 mg _________ from brinjal/100 g BW/day
By comparison with the promoters of _____________ genes, which are also induced by __, we suggest that GARE is coupled with the upstream element and the pyrimidine box to form a __ response complex

Our data demonstrate, that activation of mitogen activated protein (MAP) kinase alone is sufficient to promote ___ secretion, whereas inhibition of MAP kinase will reduce ___ secretion only when ____________________ or phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase are additionally inhibited

These results suggest that, in isolated white adipocytes, the released adenosine acts as a helper and/or a positive regulator for _______ in the release of leptin via an activation of adenosine A1 receptors that involves the ___-PKC pathway.

The etiology for diabetes mellitus in PWS may be related to the morbid obesity and consequent _______ resistance, because a decrease of ________ neurons and leptin resistance in PWS may cause hyperphagia, inducing obesity

METHODS: We have therefore studied possible associations of the Gln27Glu and the Gly16Arg polymorphisms in the beta2AR with BMI, plasma ______ and _____ mRNA expression in the intraperitoneal adipose tissue in a population of Caucasian women
Furthermore, no association was found between the Gln27Glu or the Gly16Arg polymorphisms and plasma ______ or adipose tissue _____ gene expression in either group
Aggregated beta _______ peptide 1-40 decreases Ca2+- and cholinergic receptor-mediated phosphoinositide degradation by alteration of membrane and cytosolic _______________ in brain cortex

The effects of full-length _______ beta protein, A(beta) (1-40), on phosphoinositide-specific _______________ (PLC) were investigated in synaptic plasma membranes (SPM) and cytosol prepared from the cerebral cortex of adult rats
Aggregated _______ also decreased significantly the level of diacylglycerol, the product of ___
This additionally supports the inhibitory effect of _______ on membrane-bound and cytosolic ___
Moreover, ______________ significantly decreased the basal activity of the ________ in SPM and the enzyme activity regulated through cholinergic receptors

Pretreatment of HEK-293 cells for 2 min with carbachol, a mAChR agonist, lysophosphatidic acid, or ATP, followed by agonist washout, strongly increased (by 2-3-fold) maximal ___ stimulation (measured >/=40 min later) by epidermal growth factor and platelet-derived growth factor, but not _______, and largely enhanced ___ sensitivity to these RTK agonists
Influence of obesity and menopausal status on serum ______, cholecystokinin, galanin and ______________ levels

Obesity occurs in 60% of women after menopause and is characterized by an excess of adipose tissue that depends on several orexigenic (______________ (NPY) stimulates carbohydrate ingestion, galanin stimulates fat intake) and anorectic (______, cholecystokinin (CCK)) factors
Both ______ and insulin can reduce hypothalamic ___ production and secretion

We investigated basal levels of serum ______, CCK, galanin and ___ in 16 non-obese premenopausal women, in 15 obese premenopausal women (body mass index (BMI) 34.6 +/- 1.3 SD) and in ten obese postmenopausal women (BMI 34.7 +/- 1.5 SD) to determine the relationship between obesity, menopause and these neuropeptides

Significantly increased ______ and galanin levels in postmenopausal obese women coupled with decreased ___ levels revealed some changes in the neuropeptides regulating eating behavior, which may be the reason for the onset of postmenopausal obesity
These findings are consistent with increased ______ signaling to the ___ and POMC neurons in the ARC by physiological levels of circulating ______ during normal feeding
______ Rapidly Inhibits Hypothalamic ______________ Secretion and Stimulates Corticotropin-Releasing Hormone Secretion in Adrenalectomized Mice

______ may rapidly inhibit food intake by altering the secretion of hypothalamic neuropeptides such as ______________ (NPY), a stimulator of food intake, and/or corticotropin-releasing hormone (CRH), an inhibitor of food intake

We measured concentrations of ___ and CRH in specific hypothalamic regions [i.e., arcuate nucleus (ARC), paraventricular nucleus (PVN), ventromedial nucleus and dorsomedial nucleus] of 7- to 8-wk-old lean and ob/ob mice at 1 or 3 h after intracerebroventricular ______ administration
No rapid-onset effects of ______ on hypothalamic ___ or CRH concentrations were observed in intact mice
The addition of ______ to hypothalamic preparations from intact mice also did not alter ___ or CRH secretion
Within 20 min after exposure to ______, ___ secretion from hypothalamic preparations obtained from adrenalectomized mice was lowered by 27% and CRH secretion was elevated by 51%

The current study demonstrates that ______ rapidly influences the secretion of hypothalamic ___ and CRH and that these actions of ______ within the hypothalamus are restrained by the presence of endogenous corticosterone
